Union Station St. Louis
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Link, Theodore C. (American architect, St. Louis, MO, 1850-1923) [work]

mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: View from across street, in snow

St. Louis Union Station, a National Historic Landmark, was a passenger train terminal in St. Louis, Missouri. Once the world's largest and busiest train station, it was converted in the early 1980s into a luxury hotel, shopping center, and entertainment complex. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Union_Station_%28St._Louis%29 [work]
